thread.title: Johnston Press sees lower FY profit as advertisers spent less during polls
thread.title_full: Johnston Press sees lower FY profit as advertisers spent less during polls

title: Johnston Press sees lower FY profit as advertisers spent less during polls
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Jul 14, 2015, 08:05 BST - UK Markets close in 8 hrs 25 mins Johnston Press sees lower FY profit as advertisers spent less during polls Reuters - UK Focus – 27 minutes ago 0.0016 0.0000 
July 14 (Reuters) - Johnston Press Plc, publisher of "The Scotsman" and "The Yorkshire Post", said it expected its full-year profit to be slightly below market expectations, after advertisers tightened their purse strings during the elections. 
Edinburgh-based Johnston Press said its first-half profit would be marginally lower, coupled with a 5 percent fall in revenue for the 26 weeks ended July 4. 
First (Other OTC: FSTC - news ) -half advertising revenue is expected to fall 5 percent, with a 5.5 percent fall in circulation revenue. 
Around the time of the election, a number of national and local advertisers chose to reduce or delay their spend in both print and online, the company said. (Reporting by Noor Zainab Hussain in Bengaluru; Editing by Anupama Dwivedi) Tax cuts, pensions, childcare, online accounts and beer duty, here's … Related Stock Articles Follow the quotes you care about most.
